description_txt: stated on September 20, 2013 in a press release:

description_txt: stated on September 16, 2013 in an opinion column in the Austin American-Statesman:
quote_txt: Wendy Davis is "the most popular politician in Texas."

description_txt: stated on September 18, 2013 in a conversation with workers:
quote_txt: "You have to get a license to fish on our beaches."

description_txt: stated on September 5, 2013 in a statement:
quote_txt: "Governor Deal has increased education spending every year he’s been in office."

description_txt: stated on September 6, 2013 in a TV ad.:

description_txt: stated on August 23, 2013 in a speech to students at the Rutgers New Brunswick campus:

description_txt: stated on September 18, 2013 in a legislative hearing:
quote_txt: "We’ve used (generally accepted accounting principles) here in this building the last two years."

description_txt: stated on September 18, 2013 in an episode of CNN's "Crossfire":

description_txt: stated on September 18, 2013 in an interview on CNN's "Crossfire":
quote_txt: "Ninety-five percent of all the wages in Texas are above minimum wage."

description_txt: stated on September 18, 2013 in a discussion on CNN's "Crossfire":
quote_txt: "Every engine manufacturer in the United States is now in the state of Texas."

description_txt: stated on September 18, 2013 in a discussion on CNN's "Crossfire":
quote_txt: Since 2007, "Texas has gained 440,000 people" while "Maryland has lost 20,000."

description_txt: stated on September 9, 2013 in a newsletter.:
quote_txt: "More than 400 car crashes occur each year on the current, congested Columbia River Bridge."

description_txt: stated on September 12, 2013 in a "Tampa Tribune" blog:

description_txt: stated on September 17, 2013 in a TV ad.:

description_txt: stated on September 5, 2013 in an interview:
quote_txt: The Capitol Police force is "going so far as to use paramilitary equipment" in dealing with singing protesters in Madison

description_txt: stated on September 15, 2013 in an interview with Fox News:
quote_txt: The employer mandate "affects only 5 percent of businesses in this country."

description_txt: stated on August 26, 2013 in prepared remarks for speech to Texas Alliance for Life:
quote_txt: According to an article in the Economist magazine, Americans are "guaranteed" to live above the poverty line if they graduate from high school, keep their first job for over a year and get and stay married.

description_txt: stated on September 10, 2013 in a mayoral forum:
quote_txt: "Tampa got more (federal housing) money because they scored higher on the blight scoring system, so they've got a much bigger problem than we do."

description_txt: stated on September 13, 2013 in a discussion on CNN's "Crossfire":
quote_txt: "The CDC issued a report commissioned by President Obama just earlier this year, and it found some very inconvenient facts. Armed citizens are less likely harmed by attackers. Effectiveness of gun control laws is mixed. Gun buybacks don't work."

description_txt: stated on September 12, 2013 in a press release:
quote_txt: An average of seven children in America are killed by guns every day.

description_txt: stated on August 30, 2013 in an interview:
